Entries.question: What is your favorite place on campus?
What are you?
Was NYU Abu Dhabi your first choice?
How did you find out about NYU Abu Dhabi?
What has been your experience with the UAE's culture?
What are you?
What can I talk to you about?
What is it like to be part of such a diverse community?
Why did you choose NYUAD ?
Why did you choose a liberal arts university?
Did you apply to other universities?
What are you majoring in?
What classes have you taken outside your major?
What are you involved with besides Academics?
How was your Candidate Weekend?
Where do NYUAD Professors come from?
Entries.answer: Just like the students, NYU Abu Dhabi professors come from all around the world.

Entries.question: How large are that class sizes at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: Classes at NYU Abu Dhabi are relatively small. Most classes range between 10 and 30 students.

Entries.question: Who is the President of NYU?
Entries.answer: As of January 2016 Andrew Hamilton has been the president of New York University. President Hamilton was the Vice Chancellor at the University of Oxford from 2009 to 2015, and before then he was the provost of Yale University from 2004 till 2009.

Entries.question: How did NYU Abu Dhabi come about?
Entries.answer: In the academic year 2005-06, representatives of NYU and the Emirate of Abu Dhabi met and recognized that a partnership between the government of Abu Dhabi - with its goal of establishing world-class educational and cultural institutions in the UAE - and NYU - with its goal of achieving a truly international, global network university - could be furthered through the establishment of NYU Abu Dhabi.

Entries.question: What was the agreement to build NYU Abu Dhabi based on?
Entries.answer: The agreement to build NYU Abu Dhabi is based on a shared understanding of the essential role of quality higher education in a global society: a common belief in the value of a liberal arts and sciences education; concurrence on the benefits a research university brings to the society that sustains it; a conviction that interaction with new ideas and those who are different is valuable; and a commitment to educating students who are citizens of the world, prepared to lead at home and contribute to global trade, politics, and culture.

Entries.question: Who is John Sexton?
Entries.answer: John Sexton is the President Emeritus of New York University. He teaches 'The U.S. Supreme Court's Treatment of the Relationship Between Church and State". Before becoming New York University's President, President Emeritus Sexton was a professor at NYU Law School. He was named the Law School's Dean in 1988 and became the University's President in 2001, a position he held through 2015.

Entries.question: Who is Charlie?
Entries.answer: Charlie was John Sextons mentor when he was in school. Through John he has been the inspiration of what NYU has become.

Entries.question: What are NYU Global Sites?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi students get the opportunity to study away at one of the NYU Global sites during their four years for a semester away and a J-Term class. NYU global sites are academic centers located in 14 cities across the seven contenents.

Entries.question: Is it true that if I do my four years at NYUAD I can study away for a semester in one of the other NYU Global Sites?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi students get the opportunity to study away at one of the NYU Global sites during their four years for a semester away and a J-Term class. NYU global sites are academic centers located in 14 cities across the seven contenents.

Entries.question: Where are the NYU Global Sites located?
Entries.answer: NYU has three campuses around the world located in each of New York, Shanghai and Abu Dhabi. It also has global sites located in Whashington DC in the United States, Boenos Aires in Argentina, Berlin in Garmany, Florence in Italy, London in the United Kingdom, Madrid in Spain, Paris in France, Prague in the Czech Republic, Accra in Ghana, Syndney in Australia, and Tel Aviv in Isreal

Entries.question: How is NYUAD different from NYU?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi is a residential research university and a branch of NYU New York, operated consistent with NYU New York's academic quality and practices.New York University in Abu Dhabi Corporation is a New York not-for-profit, which is registered as a branch of a foreign entity in Abu Dhabi and supports NYU in fulfilling its educational and research mission and contributing to the evolution of Abu Dhabi as an international center of ideas and human capital development.

Entries.question: Is it true that NYU is cutting ties with NYUAD?
Entries.answer: NYU New York is not cutting ties with NYU Abu Dhabi, the articles released are misleading, and inaccurate.

Entries.question: What is the vision of NYUAD?
Entries.answer: Both the government of Abu Dhabi and NYU are committed to building a US-style, research-focused educational institution. NYU Abu Dhabi equips students for leadership in all arenas of human endeavor. It fosters curiosity, creativity, and critical reflection. At NYU Abu Dhabi, faculty and students extend the frontiers of knowledge, and they extend themselves.New York University in Abu Dhabi Corporation is a New York not-for-profit, which is registered as a branch of a foreign entity in Abu Dhabi and supports NYU in fulfilling its educational and research mission and contributing to the evolution of Abu Dhabi as an international center of ideas and human capital development.

Entries.question: Where are most NYUAD students from?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi's high-achieving students have come from 115 nations and speak over 115 languages.

Entries.question: Where is the NYUAD campus located?
Entries.answer: Saadiyat Marina District, Abu Dhabi

Entries.question: What has NYUAD done to address the concerns about the treatment of the individuals who worked on the construction phase of the campus?
What is a liberal arts school?
Does NYUAD have a library on campus?
Entries.answer: Absolutely, located on the top floor of the Campus Center, the NYU Abu Dhabi Library provides spaces for engagement between faculty and students, complemented by quiet areas for concentration and contemplation. Comfortable reading areas and study rooms create a productive atmosphere for research.

Entries.question: Is NYUAD co-educational?
Entries.answer: Classrooms at NYU Abu Dhabi are co-educational.

Entries.question: Are classrooms gender segregated at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: Classrooms at NYU Abu Dhabi are co-educational.

Entries.question: Are NYUNY students able to study away in Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: NYU New York and NYU Shanghai students have the opportunity to apply to study for a semester at NYU Abu Dhabi.

Entries.question: Are NYUAD students able to study away at NYU global sites?
Entries.answer: Yes, students are encouraged to spend up to two semesters over their four years at NYUAD studying abroad at any of NYU's 14 global academic centers.

Entries.question: What is the NYUAD Institute?
Entries.answer: The NYU Abu Dhabi Institute brings people together to experience vitally new ideas and discuss pressing global issues. The Institute presents academic conferences, research workshops, public lectures, conversations with authors and artists, films, and co-sponsors exhibitions in both Abu Dhabi and New York.The Institute is a cornerstone of academic excellence at NYU Abu Dhabi.

Entries.question: What is the Arts Centre?
Entries.answer: The NYUAD Arts Centre is a complex of theaters and performance venues, a project space gallery, rehearsals rooms, film editing studios, classrooms, and workshops that houses NYU Abu Dhabi's Theater, Music, Film, Visual Arts, and New Media Studies departments. The Arts Center presents distinguished professional artists from around the world alongside student, faculty, and community productions.The Arts Center offers NYUAD compelling programming that connects to the curriculum and illuminates the scholarly pursuits of students and faculty.

Entries.question: Can NYUAD students access Arts Centre and Institute events for free?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi Institue and Arts Centre have been open for the public free of cost.

Entries.question: Can you tell me more about Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: Abu Dhabi is the largest of the seven emirates that make up the United Arab Emirates. It occupies nearly 87 percent of the country's total landmass and includes the capital - the city of Abu Dhabi - and a second major city named Al Ain, located near the emirate's border with Oman. According to the 2005 census, the Emirate of Abu Dhabi is home to over 1.3 million people, the majority of whom are expatriates.

Entries.question: Is it true that Abu Dhabi gets all of its financial resources from oil?
Entries.answer: The Emirate of Abu Dhabi holds 9 percent of the world's proven oil reserves and almost 5 percent of the world's proven supplies of natural gas. However, the government of Abu Dhabi is overseeing an ambitious strategy to diversify the local economy over the next two to three decades to ensure that the emirate continues to grow in a balanced and sustainable way.

Entries.question: What is Abu Dhabi's stand on education and higher education?
Entries.answer: From the government's perspective, significant and ongoing investment in education is central to the successful achievement of all of its social and economic objectives, and the establishment of NYU Abu Dhabi is an important element in that effort. Among the UAE national population, there are currently more women than men enrolled in higher education.
Established in 1971, the UAE is a federation with two separate levels of government. Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan, the ruler of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, is also the president of the country.

Entries.question: Where is the campus?
Entries.answer: The NYU Abu Dhabi campus is located on Saadiyat Island. Saadiyat is home to a few emerging artistic and cultural landmarks including the Louvre Museum and the Guggenheim Museum.

Entries.question: What can I do aound saadiyat?
Entries.answer: Manarat alsaadiyat, Louvre museum, Warehouse 421, Guggenheim, Sheikh Zayed Museum.

Entries.question: What can I do for fun in Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: There are many ferstivals year-round, NYUAD Art Centre and Institute, museums, ferrari world, etc.

Entries.question: Do I have to wear a headscarf?
Entries.answer: You do not have to wear a headscarf.

Entries.question: What is the national dress?
Entries.answer: The Emirati national dress for men is called the Kandoura. For women it is called the Abaya.

Entries.question: Will I need to learn Arabic to get by in Abu Dhabi and the UAE?
Entries.answer: You do not need to learn Arabic to get by in Abu Dhabi.

Entries.question: How safe is it living in Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: Abu Dhabi is an extremely safe city.

Entries.question: How should I dress when in Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: Abu Dhabi is considered conservative but tolerant when it comes to dress code. Given the diverse nature of the population, one can see many different types of dress in Abu Dhabi (jeans, saris, business suits, dishdashas, and abayas). Visitors are free to wear the same clothes that they would wear at home, but both men and women typically refrain from wearing excessively revealing clothing out of respect for the local culture and customs. For most of the year, lightweight summer clothing is suitable. Warmer clothes are needed during the winter months, especially in the evening.

Entries.question: What does Abu Dhabi mean in English?
Entries.answer: Abu Dhabi translates literally to "father of the gazelle," in reference to an indigenous type of deer said to have inhabited the area. To this day, a particular species of native Arabian gazelle is referred to as "dhabi" in Arabic.

Entries.question: Tell me a little about the history of the UAE.
Entries.answer: The United Arab Emirates was established as a nation on December 2, 1971. When the British announced their intention to withdraw from the region, the late Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan, the founder and first president of the UAE, successfully negotiated agreements between the emirates that now make up the nation.

Entries.question: What type of government does the UAE have?
Entries.answer: The United Arab Emirates has a federal government with seven regional subdivisions, called emirates. The head of the federal government is the president, Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan. Abu Dhabi is the name of both the capital city and the largest of the emirates. The seven emirates are Abu Dhabi, Ajman, Dubai, Fujairah, Ras al-Khaimah, Sharjah, and Umm al-Qaiwain.

Entries.question: Tell me a little about Abu Dhabi's geography.
Entries.answer: The Emirate of Abu Dhabi makes up approximately 87 percent of the country's total landmass. About 70 percent of the land is desert, but Abu Dhabi also has 700 kilometers of coastline and some 200 islands.

Entries.question: What is the climate like in Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: The climate of Abu Dhabi is hot and arid. From June to September maximum temperatures average above 35 degrees Celsius (95 degrees Fahrenheit) and the humidity is high. During the cooler months, from November to March, average temperatures range from 18 degrees Celsius (64.4 degrees Fahrenheit) to 25 degrees Celsius (77 degrees Fahrenheit). There is very little rainfall in Abu Dhabi; February is generally the wettest month, with an average rainfall of 42 millimeters (1.65 inches).

Entries.question: What are the languages spoken in Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: Arabic is the official language of government and business in the UAE, although English, Persian, Hindi, and Urdu are also spoken. All signs (road, store, restaurant, etc.) are either in English or in both English and Arabic. It is quite easy to navigate the city using English. As a general rule, a wider range of languages is spoken - and with a higher level of fluency - in major cities than in rural areas.

Entries.question: What are the demographics of the UAE?
Entries.answer: The UAE's population is about 8.3 million and it is one of the most ethnically diverse in the Middle East. Roughly 11 percent of the population is Emirati; with other major demographic groups including South Asians, other Arab nationals, East Asians, and Western expatriates.

Entries.question: Does the UAE relate itself to a specific religion?
Entries.answer: The official religion of the UAE is Islam, although other religions are respected and practiced freely.

Entries.question: What is the currency used in the UAE?
Entries.answer: The currency of the UAE is the dirham, which is divided into 100 fils. The UAE dirham is fixed to the US dollar at a rate of 3.67 dirham to the dollar.

Entries.question: What timezone is Abu Dhabi in?
Entries.answer: The UAE is in Greenwich Mean Time plus four hours, or nine hours ahead of New York in Standard Time. During Daylight Savings Time, Abu Dhabi is eight hours ahead of New York.

Entries.question: How feasible is it to explore the seven other emirates if I study in Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: It is easy to travel to any of the emirates from Abu Dhabi. They make nice long weekend trips. Student Life provides trips to each of the other Emirates throughout the semester.

Entries.question: How can one go about exploring learning more about the culture of the UAE?
Entries.answer: Meeting with Emiratis is always a good way of getting an insight into the culture. The campus life office provides many opportunities to experience the culture from events to trips.

Entries.question: How does NYUAD support students in adjusting to life in the UAE?
Entries.answer: The office of First Year Programming helps all new students adjust to life in the UAE

Entries.question: Tell me about driving in the UAE
Entries.answer: Some countries' driver licenses can be converted automatically. Please check with the Emirates Driving Company

Entries.question: Can women drive in the UAE
Entries.answer: Women can drive in the UAE.

Entries.question: Can I triple major at NYUAD?
When do I have to declare my major?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi students have to declare their majors by the end of the forth semester. However, some major require that you declare it earlier to enroll in certain classes.

Entries.question: What PE courses are available?
Entries.answer: There are a variety of PE courses available for students, from fitness classes to sports such as performce boxing and swimming.

Entries.question: Do I have to take PE courses?
Entries.answer: All students are required to complete two seven-week Physical Education sessions as a graduation requirement.

Entries.question: Why do I have to take PE courses?
Entries.answer: Here at NYU Abu Dhabi we believe that physical fitness is an important aspect of overall student development. Thus, completing two seven-week courses is a graduation requirement.

Entries.question: What is the difference between Computer Engineering and Computer Science?
Entries.answer: Computer Engineering is more focused on hardware; while Computer Science is more foused on software.

Entries.question: What degrees does NYUAD offer?
Entries.answer: As of 2017, NYUAD offers Bachelor of Science, Bachelor of Arts, and PhD in a limited number of fields.

Entries.question: Can I major in Engineering at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: The Engineering divisions at NYU Abu Dhabi offers five degrees in Engineering: General Engineering, Mechanical, Electrical, Civil and Computer Engineering.

Entries.question: In what language is academic work conducted?
Entries.answer: Academic work at NYU Abu Dhabi is conducted in English.

Entries.question: Does NYUAD ensure NYU's quality expectations?
Do the norms of academic freedom prevail at NYUAD?
Can I take classes outside of my majors?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi encourages students to take classes in multiple disciplines outside of their majors. Students are also required to complete the Core Curriculum program requirements in order to graduate.

Entries.question: What is a capstone?
Entries.answer: A capstone is a year long research project that students are required to fulfill in their academic field. I am in fact, a result of a capstone project in Computer Science carried by a team of six NYU Abu Dhabi students.

Entries.question: What are pre-requisites and co-requisites?
Entries.answer: Pre-requisites are courses that you must complete before enrolling in a given course. Co-requisites are courses that must either complete or be enrolled in to enroll in the given course.

Entries.question: How is the workload at NYU Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: The workload at NYU Abu Dhabi differs from one course to another. Some courses have a light workload while other have a heavier workload.

Entries.question: Academic Freedom
Entries.answer: Academic freedom is an critical aspect of our vision at NYU Abu Dhabi.

Entries.question: What is a J-Term?
Entries.answer: J-Term or January Term offers one month long intensive courses. Students are required to complete three J-Term courses throughout their four years, and can do one in one of our global sites.

Entries.question: How does NYU Abu Dhabi decide which student to admit?
Entries.answer: Admission to NYU Abu Dhabi is highly selective. Students are admitted based on academic excellence, extracurricular activities, and demonstrated interest in global citizenship, service, and leadership.

Entries.question: Are there minimum standarized test scores required for admissions?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi does not use numerical cut-offs when we evaluate applications. However, admission to NYU Abu Dhabi is very competitive. As a general rule, applicants with the strongest academic programs, the highest grades, and the highest test scores are most likely to be offered admission. For more information, please see NYU Abu Dhabi's official testing policy.

Entries.question: Which standarized test scores do I need to submit for my application?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi encourages students to present their best case for consideration for admission. We welcome you to provide official results of any nationally or internationally recognized standardized tests you have completed. Test scores are an important part of your application. They provide us with a better sense of your English language proficiency, and of your ability to succeed at NYU Abu Dhabi. But they are not the only factor on which your admission decision will be based. Please see our testing policy for complete details.

Entries.question: Is the TOEFL required for consideration for admission to NYU Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: English is the language of instruction at NYU Abu Dhabi. NYUAD does not currently require an English language proficiency test (TOEFL or IELTS, etc.), however, we strongly encourage students to take an English language proficiency test and submit their scores. Excellent English language skills are critical to success at NYU Abu Dhabi. Please see NYUAD's official testing policy for more information.

Entries.question: Are national exams vaild to fulfill the testing requirement?
Entries.answer: National exams are often sufficient to satisfy our standardized test requirement. You may submit results for a nationally accredited exam that: Signifies the completion of secondary education in your home country (or region), and Is administered independently of the your school. You can find a list of accepted tests on our website

Entries.question: Will NYU Abu Dhabi consider my Internation score?
Entries.answer: Yes, the International Baccalaureate Diploma (predicted result followed by official verification) will satisfy NYU Abu Dhabi's standardized test requirement. NYU Abu Dhabi will make an admission decision using a student's predicted IB scores. If final test results vary greatly from the predicted results, NYU Abu Dhabi may withdraw the offer of admission.

Entries.question: What is most important in the admissions decision?
Entries.answer: NYUAD looks at your entire application: grades, test scores, extracurricular work, evaluations, recommendations, and all information shared as part of the application.

Entries.question: Does NYU Abu Dhabi take into consideration the difficulty of a particular curriculum or different secondary school grading policies when making admissions decisions?
Entries.answer: Yes. We encourage you to take the most challenging curriculum available, because when we evaluate your record, we consider the rigor of the program you've completed. It is also essential to complete the highest available terminating grade (e.g., the full 13 years of the British curriculum) of secondary school.

Entries.question: Is Admissions open to all?
Entries.answer: Yes. Citizens of all nations are welcome to apply, and admission is "need blind." Students are chosen based on their academic potential and qualifications, according to the same standards - including non-discrimination standards - that govern admission to NYU's campus in New York. Economic background and nationality do not influence our admission decision.

Entries.question: How important are letters of evaluation/recommendation?
Entries.answer: Letters of evaluation and recommendation are extremely important. They give the admissions committee a more complete picture of your performance both in and outside the classroom, from the point of view of a professional who knows you well. We consider these letters within the overall context of your application, and we may contact the counselors or teachers who write them if we have questions about a your performance.

Entries.question: Does NYU Abu Dhabi accept the common application?
Entries.answer: Yes, in fact, NYU Abu Dhabi requires the Common Application. In addition to the Common Application, you must also submit the NYU Supplement to the Common Application. Applications to NYU Abu Dhabi are not considered complete until we have received BOTH pieces of the application.

Entries.question: Can I apply online?
Entries.answer: Yes, we strongly encourage you to apply online using the Common Application. If for some reason you cannot apply online, please contact your regional representative to discuss alternative methods of applying.

Entries.question: Can I apply to more than one NYU campus at a time?
Entries.answer: Yes. You can indicate your interest in being considered for any combination of our campuses - New York, Abu Dhabi, and Shanghai - on the NYU Supplement to the Common Application.

Entries.question: How important are dealines?
Entries.answer: Deadlines are extremely important. We cannot guarantee that we will read applications submitted after the deadline date, even if only one piece of the application is missing. We highly recommend that you submit your application and all supporting documents as early as possible. If you foresee a delay in submitting any of your supporting documents, please contact the NYU Abu Dhabi Admissions office to discuss your particular situation. Knowing the deadlines, you should plan the dates for your standardized tests accordingly, and give your recommenders plenty of time to complete their letters of recommendation.

Entries.question: Should I schedule an interview?
Entries.answer: Not all applicants will have the opportunity to participate in an admissions interview. Select applicants will be invited to meet with members of the admissions committee during one of the Candidate Weekends, which will take place in Abu Dhabi. All eligible candidates will be contacted by NYU Abu Dhabi to arrange for this visit. Whenever possible, we encourage all applicants to visit the NYU Abu Dhabi campus or attend an information session in their city or region.

Entries.question: Are there any requirements I should know about?
Entries.answer: In addition to your application, all candidates are required to have a valid passport. If you are chosen to participate in a Candidate Weekend, you will need to be able to travel to Abu Dhabi. NYU Abu Dhabi will cover the costs of this travel and assist with the visa process for all admitted or invited students, but you must ensure that they have a valid passport for travel.

Entries.question: When will I hear if I get admitted?
Entries.answer: If you apply for ED 1 you'll here back by mid-December, if you apply ED2 you'll hear back by end of February, and if you apply RD you will hear back by April first. Admitted students will be notified of a financial support award at the same time.

Entries.question: If I'm not admitted can I reapply?
Entries.answer: You are free to reapply if you are not admitted. However, we make our admissions decisions based on a thorough analysis of each student's application and credentials, and we urge you to reapply only if there has been a meaningful change in your qualifications for NYU Abu Dhabi.

Entries.question: I am an undergraduate at another university, can I apply to NYU Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: Yes, you are eligible to apply for admission to NYU Abu Dhabi even if you have started working toward an undergraduate degree at another school. However, regardless of the amount or level of coursework already completed, all students will enter NYU Abu Dhabi as first year students for a four-year course of study. At this time, however, we discourage students who have completed two years or more of an undergraduate degree from applying.

Entries.question: Do you accept transfer applicants?
Entries.answer: At this time, we do not accept transfer applications. All students must enter in September as first-year students.

Entries.question: Am I able to change campus location after I enroll?
Entries.answer: NYU is fully committed to the well-being of our students, and we will do everything we can to make sure a student's experience is both academically and socially fulfilling. However, should a student decide that the campus at which they matriculate is not the right fit for him or her, a request for a change of campus will be given consideration. If a request for change of campus is approved, the Financial Aid office will evaluate a student's financial circumstances in the context of financial aid packages offered at the new campus. Financial aid packages vary greatly among our three campuses, so students should be aware of this reality should transferring become a consideration.

Entries.question: Do you accept applicants who already hold a bachelor of arts or scince degrees?
Entries.answer: There are only two programs at NYU that offer second bachelor's degrees: the second bachelor's degree in Nursing and the second bachelor's degree in Engineering. Both of these programs are housed at our New York City campus. NYU Abu Dhabi does not offer any second bachelor's degree programs.

Entries.question: What is NYU Abu Dhabi's tuition? What opportunities are there for financial assistance?
Entries.answer: Our aim is to attract the best possible students regardless of financial circumstances. If you are admitted, our priority is to work with you and your family to make it possible for you to attend. NYU Abu Dhabi's Office of Financial Support will tailor the University's generous financial assistance programs to your individual needs. Financial support will ensure that the cost of attendance does not require you or your family to take on debt to support the cost of your education at NYU Abu Dhabi. Your family's finances should not affect your decision to select NYU Abu Dhabi, even if you are considering low- or no-cost public education alternatives or are the recipient of generous financial assistance from another institution. In addition, financial support from NYU Abu Dhabi will apply not only to the cost of attendance, but also to many activities and opportunities available to NYU Abu Dhabi students.

Entries.question: Do you hold open house or informal information session programs?
From where will students come, and how many?
Entries.answer: You can always find up-to-date information about the NYU Abu Dhabi student body, detailed information about select students and their experiences, and comprehensive class profiles on the Student Profiles page of our site.

Entries.question: How can I find out more about academics and campus life at NYU Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: Please explore NYU Abu Dhabi Academic Programs, visit the Campus Life section of the website, and check out our blog to learn more about student activities and events in and around Abu Dhabi.

Entries.question: If I get accepted, can I defer a year before joining NYUAD?
Entries.answer: If you've been offered admission to NYU Abu Dhabi, you may request to defer your enrollment for up to one year. If your request is approved and you meet the requirements listed below, you do not have to file a new application and are guaranteed readmission for the next fall semester.

Entries.question: What are the graduating requirements
Entries.answer: Graduating requirements differ from major to major so it depends on your situation.

Entries.question: Do I have to decide my major before coming to NYUAD?
Entries.answer: Students need to declare their majors only by the end of their third semester. Students do not have to decide on their major before coming to NYUAD.

Entries.question: What are the different majors offered?
Entries.answer: NYUAD offers 22 majors, and numerous multidisciplinary minors and specializations. Arab Crossroads Studies, Art and Art History, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Economics, Film and New media, History,Literature and Creative Writing, Mathematics, Music,Philosophy, Physics Political Science, Psychology, Social Research and Public Policy, Theatre. In addition to 5 Engineering majors, Civil, Computer, Electrical, General and Mechanical Enigineering.

Entries.question: What does admissions look for in a student?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi draws students of all backgrounds from around the world to create a uniquely diverse and dynamic student body. Admission to NYU Abu Dhabi is highly selective and you will need to demonstrate, through your application, academic excellence, sustained and meaningful extracurricular involvement, strong and supportive letters of recommendation, commitment to supporting a global, interconnected community through service and leadership

Entries.question: What's the minimum scores _____ that can get me into NYUAD?
Entries.answer: There are no minimum scores for tests, but to give you an idea these are the average test scores for the class of 2021, For the SAT the 75th percentile for the SAT Math score was 780 (with 20 students receiving perfect 800 scores), while at the 25th percentile, the score was 700. At the 75th percentile for Evidence-Based Reading & Writing was 750 (with 5 students receiving perfect 800 scores). At the 25th percentile, it was 650. The median overall SAT score was 1,460 (out of the 1,600 scale). For the ACT the median composite score was 32 out of a 36-point scale, and for the International Baccalaureate the students reported a median predicted score of 39 (out of a scale of 42).

Entries.question: When should I apply for NYU Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: If you are interested in applying to NYU Abu Dhabi, the best time to start is by the end of your junior year in highschool. Our first early decision deadline is on the first of November, while the second Early Decision and Regular decision dealine is on the firt of January.

Entries.question: When is the application deadline
Entries.answer: The application deadline varies based on your application decision, for Early decision 1 students the deadline in November 1st and they will get a reply by the 15th od December. Early decision 2 and regular decision students must submit their applications before the 1st of January. While Early decision 2 students get their application decision on February the 15th, regular decision students get their decisions on April 1st.

Entries.question: What is Candidate Weekend?
Entries.answer: Candidate Weekend is a unique part of the NYU Abu Dhabi admissions process, a chance to experience life in NYU Abu Dhabi's global community and explore the cosmopolitan city of Abu Dhabi.

Entries.question: What do candidates get to do during Candidate Weekend?
Entries.answer: As a participant, you will a take sample class, engage in one-on-one discussions with NYUAD leadership and faculty, meet your fellow candidates and current students, and learn as much as possible about the opportunities available to NYUAD students - all in just under 48 hours!

Entries.question: When is Candidate Weekend?
Entries.answer: The dates for candidate weekend will vary based on when you submitted your application, early decision one students will be invited between December 7th to 10th, early decision two students will be invited between February 1st to 4th and regular decision students will be invited between February 22nd to 25th or between March 8th to 11th.

Entries.question: Where is Candidate Weekend?
Entries.answer: Candidate Weekend will be held in AbuDhabi, some of the events will take place on campus while others will be off campus.

Entries.question: What is the difference between Early Decision and Regular Decision?
Entries.answer: Students will submit their applications before November 1st and receive their admissions decisions soon after on the 15th of December. Early Decision is binding, which means that any student who applies and is admitted to a school through Early Decision is expected to enroll. Whereas regular decision students must submit their applications before January 1st and the applications are non-binding. This means that upon acceptance the student still has the choice of choosing a different school.

Entries.question: What is financial aid?
Entries.answer: NYUAD provides financial support in the form of fellowships and need-based grants, to those who qualify. The support may cover up to the full cost of attendance, including tuition, foreign travel for study integral to a student's academic program, room and board, health insurance, personal expenses, books, and many student life activities. Financial support may also include up to two tickets each year between Abu Dhabi and the student's country of permanent residence.

Entries.question: What are the scholarships offered?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi does not offer scholarships, but it does offer Financial Aid given on need-basis

Entries.question: What are the financial aid plans that NYU Abu Dhabi provides?
Entries.answer: Every admitted student is also automatically considered for merit-based fellowships. Need-based support may cover up to the full cost of attendance, including tuition, foreign travel for study integral to a student's academic program, room and board, health insurance, personal expenses, books, and many student life activities. Financial support may also include up to two tickets each year between Abu Dhabi and the student's country of permanent residence.

Entries.question: Would I be eligible for a scholarship if I have a partial scholarship with someone else?
Entries.answer: With these situations each case is looked at seartley and the decisions are made on a case to case basis. I would suggest talking to someone in the...

Entries.question: If I get accepted, can I transfer credits from another university?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi accepts application from university students, but does not accept transferral of credits. All students are start at NYU Abu Dhabi as first year students.

Entries.question: LOA - military service
SMSP - Emerging Scholars Program
Are there student clubs at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: There are clubs at NYUAD called Student Interest Groups (SIGs)

Entries.question: What are Student Interest Groups?
Entries.answer: There are two types of Student Interest Groups: Student Organizations - an organized, collective effort to explore a field, pursue a shared passion, or support a cause, and Student Teams - a group of students that work together to hone their abilities with the intent of competing.

Entries.question: Is there a Student Government at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: The Student Government is the voice of students within the NYUAD community. It serves and is ultimately accountable to the student body, upholding students' rights, promoting their welfare, and pledging to remain transparent and accessible to all students.

Entries.question: What are the responsibilities of Student Government at NYU Abu Dhabi?
Entries.answer: The primary responsibility of the Student Government is to ensure that our students have the opportunity to realize their potential, to explore new areas and activities, and to pursue their passions.

Entries.question: What are the volunteering opportunities NYUAD students have taken part in?
Entries.answer: There are a diverse range of short- and long-term volunteer opportunities that are organized by student life offices. Some of these include mentoring youth in Abu Dhabi, vocational education, and other community service opportunities with a wide range of locally based community organizations.

Entries.question: Is there an MUN team at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: One of our student teams is an MUN team that has participated in multiple MUNs locally and internationally.

Entries.question: Is there a debate team at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: The Debate Society meets on weekly basis and train for national and international debate contests.

Entries.question: Are there cultural student organizations on campus?
Entries.answer: We have a number of cultural student organizations; there are SIGs focussed on Arab, African, Latino, South Asian and many other cultures.

Entries.question: What is the Gazelle?
Entries.answer: The Gazelle is an online journal platform, founded and organized solely by students, you can read their work at www.thegazelle.org.

Entries.question: REACH
Entries.answer: REACH is a student organization that envisions a community in which every student feels safe and supported. REACH programming includes peer-to-peer counselling as well as programming focussed on self-care and consent.

Entries.question: WeSTEM
Entries.answer: weSTEM (Women Empowered in STEM) was established in order to increase the number of girls and women pursuing degrees and careers in science, technology, engineering and mathematics at our university and in the region, and it aims to provide a platform for students to promote female presence in STEM fields.

Entries.question: Is there a college sports league in Abu Dhabi or the UAE?
Entries.answer: The Abu Dhabi Inter-University Sports League (ADISL) was founded in 2012. The league has since grown to include over 15 universities throughout the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, you can check out all participating universities and more at www.adisl.ae.

Entries.question: What sports are played at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: Intercollegiate sports at NYUAD include Basketball, Football, Badminton, Table Tennis, and Volleyball.

Entries.question: Why are there no hockey, rugby or american football teams?
Entries.answer: The Althletics department supports emerging sport teams as long as there are enough students interested and committed to be part of the team.

Entries.question: How can I join a sports team at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: The Athletics department always welcomes new students to try out for intercollegiate sports teams. As for the Intramural teams, all NYUAD community members are welcome to form or join teams.

Entries.question: What are the athletics/sports facilities at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: Our campus houses a 50m Competition Pool, indoor multi-use courts for basketball, badminton, volleyball, netball, futsal, etc, a 200m indoor running track, a climbing wall, an Athletic Training Center open to all Intercollegiate (ADISL) and Club Sport athletes, and outdoor facilities that include four hard tennis courts, a 400-meter outdoor track, and two full-sized natural surface multi-purpose fields.

Entries.question: Are there any ladies only sports and fitness facilities at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: NYUAD provides a ladies only gymnasium, ladies only physical education classes and training sessions, as well as ladies only swimming hours.

Entries.question: What is the availability and cost of personal training at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: Our fitness center offers personal training sessions free of cost, as well as group classes that are open to students, faculty and staff on a first come first served basis.

Entries.question: What resources does NYUAD provide to support students with taking care of their mental health?
Entries.answer: Our Health and Wellness centre provides confidential counseling services available for all students. Peer to peer support is also provided through REACH a student organization.

Entries.question: How does NYUAD support students with their post graduation careers while in their final year?
Entries.answer: The Career Development Centre supports seniors in determining and working towards their career path through one-on-one career counseling sessions that are available throughout senior year. They offer support for job search and applications as well as global award applications and graduate school preparation.

Entries.question: How does NYUAD support students with their professional development throughout their time at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: The Career Development Centre supports students in building their professional skills througout their four years through workshops, events and one-on-one couseling sessions and by helping them in their search, selection and sometimes funding of opportunities including internships throughout the year including the summer, on-campus jobs and more.

Entries.question: What are the health and well-being services that NYUAD provides for its students?
Entries.answer: NYUAD health and wellbeing support includes counsellors, dieticians, on-campus doctors and nurses as well as personal trainers, rehabilitation support and more.

Entries.question: Does NYUAD have a health center on campus?
Entries.answer: We have a Health and Wellness center on campus that supports students in identifying and treating common medical conditions as well as providing counselling support. Our on-campus clinical staff will refer students to health professionals in Abu Dhabi, where necessary.

Entries.question: What are the food options available on campus?
Entries.answer: There are various food options on campus including the Dining Hall, the Library Cafe, the Market Place, Blacksmith Coffee and Sushi Counter that house a number of dining options for students, community members and campus visitors.

Entries.question: What are Campus Dirhams?
Entries.answer: Campus dirhams are credits available for students to spend in the dining outlets as well as the convenience store.

Entries.question: What is a Meal Plan?
Entries.answer: Meal plans provide a certain number of meals per week for students, as well as a certain amount of campus dirhams that can be used around campus.

Entries.question: How does NYUAD support students in building their professional skills?
Entries.answer: Advancement Opportunities Funding - Summer Funding - Testing Funding - Mock interviews - Internships

Entries.question: May you please tell me more about the dorms at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi residential colleges are divided into three buildings, where the floors are separated by gender. There are also designated areas within the residential colleges dedicated to non-visitation community, where individuals of the opposite sex are not permitted entry. Each floor has an assigned Resident Assistant (RA) to promote education, health, and safety and community development. Students are assigned either single or double (shared) bedroooms within each dorm.

Entries.question: Can I choose to live with my friend in the dorms?
Entries.answer: First year students are allocated dorm rooms based on a preference form as part of the housing application. After the first year, students get the opportunity to choose who they share dorms with.

Entries.question: What are the roles of resident assitants?
Entries.answer: An RA has many roles and responsibilities, including, but not limited to, providing programming opportunities to build a strong community, acting as a para-counselor for students, being a familiar first resource for academic or institutional questions, and enforcing residential college policies.

Entries.question: How can a student go about becoming an RA?
Entries.answer: Students can apply to become RAs. They undergo a rigorous selection and training process to best support their residents.

Entries.question: Does NYUAD provide dorms for its students?
Entries.answer: All students are offered dorms on campus including students who live in the UAE or in Abu Dhabi.

Entries.question: Where are NYUAD dorms located?
Entries.answer: All dorms are located on our Saadiyat campus. The highline, or the second floor, marks the residential area.

Entries.question: How do people commute between campus and the city?
Entries.answer: Our students commute beween campus and the city through NYUAD provided shuttles, taxis or the Abu Dhabi bus which stops in front of our welcome centre.

Entries.question: What is the dress code on campus?
Entries.answer: NYUAD is an open campus which members of the public are welcome to visit. As such, when students are in public areas of the university, they are expected to dress modestly, in accordance with local custom. Dressing modestly is defined as keeping your shoulders and knees covered. Dressing modestly does not include covering your hair.

Entries.question: Do I have to learn Arabic if I attend NYUAD?
Entries.answer: Students studying at NYU Abu Dhabi don't have to learn Arabic as the language of instruction is English, although many of our students do choose to enroll in Arabic Language classes that are offered.

Entries.question: Is there a curfew for people who live in dorms?
Entries.answer: Our residential campus does not enforce a curfew on students living in the dorms.

Entries.question: How can I get involved with research on campus?
Entries.answer: To get involved with faculty research on campus, the best way to go about it is to reach out to the faculty member you are intersted in working with, learn about their research and suggest to help out with the research.

Entries.question: If I am a student can I work with professors on their research?
Entries.answer: Given the small ratio of students to faculty members at NYU Abu Dhabi, students here get a lot of opportunities to get involved with faculty research on campus, whether throughout the semesters, or during the summer.

Entries.question: Are classrooms gender segregated at NYUAD?
Entries.answer: All classrooms at NYU Abu Dhabi are co-educational, except for women only physical education courses.

Entries.question: Are NYUAD students able to study away at NYU global sites?
Entries.answer: NYU Abu Dhabi students are encouraged to apply for at least one study away semester in one of our global sites and campuses.

Entries.question: How does NYUAD ensure a safe space for members of the lgbtq community
Entries.answer: NYUAD cares about providing a safe space for all of its students/community members regardless of their ethnicity, nationality, religious affiliation, and any identity association. If you have any specific questions about our diverse community please reach out to our Dean of Students office at nyuad.dos@nyu.edu

Entries.question: Can I get an on-campus job? Are there on-campus employment opportunities?
Entries.answer: There are a number of student jobs offered on campus, these are called student assistantships. Students can apply for up to 15 hours per week, earning at a rate of 30 AED per hour.

Entries.question: What opportunities does NYUAD provide for students to connect with their host country/UAE?
Entries.answer: There are a number of programs organized by student life that offer experiences to connect students to the local culture. These range from over-night trips to the Northern Emirates to conversations with Emirati professionals, mixers with students from other local universities, Ramadan and UAE Etiquette programming and so much more. All NYUAD students are encouraged to be curious about local culture and Campus Life as well as fellow Emirati students are passionate about enabling students to get to know their host country as much as possible.

Entries.question: What can I ask you about?
Entries.answer: You can ask me about campus life, admissions, NYU and Abu Dhabi. I probably won't be able to answer all your questions, but you can always check our website at nyuad.nyu.edu

Entries.question: Reply list to 'when somebody compliments me': Examples: I like your x / I love your x / You are so x / Nice x! / That's interesting!
Entries.answer: Awww thanks!

Entries.question: Reply list to 'when somebody compliments me': Examples: I like your x / I love your x / You are so x / Nice x! / That's interesting!
Entries.answer: Thank you! / Thank you.

Entries.question: Reply list to 'when somebody compliments me': Examples: I like your x / I love your x / You are so x / Nice x! / That's interesting!
Entries.answer: Thank you so much.

Entries.question: Reply list to 'when somebody compliments me': Examples: I like your x / I love your x / You are so x / Nice x! / That's interesting!
Entries.answer: That's sweet of you.

Entries.question: Reply list to 'when somebody compliments me': Examples: I like your x / I love your x / You are so x / Nice x! / That's interesting!
Entries.answer: That's nice of you to say!

Entries.question: Reply list to 'when somebody compliments me': Examples: I like your x / I love your x / You are so x / Nice x! / That's interesting!
Entries.answer: Thanks.

Entries.question: Reply list to 'when somebody asks how I found something': Examples: And did you like it? / Was it fun? / How was it? / How did you find x? / What did you think? / Was it nice? (because usually talk about my past experiences which were good anyway)

Entries.question: Reply list to 'when somebody asks how I found something': Examples: And did you like it? / Was it fun? / How was it? / How did you find x? / What did you think? / Was it nice? (because usually talk about my past experiences which were good anyway)

Entries.question: Reply list to 'Can you do x?: (and there is no such question in the library)
Entries.answer: I'm not sure I can do that.

Entries.question: Reply list to 'Can you do x?: (and there is no such question in the library)

Entries.question: Reply list to 'Can you do x?: (and there is no such question in the library)
